p: Furthermore, Sawada and co-workers prepared F-SiNPs using a bottom-up method [ 50]. The reactive silanes employed in the co-hydrolysis were N-(3-triethoxysilylpropyl)gluconamide and a fluorinated vinyltrimethoxysilane oligomer (R f(CH 2CHSi(OMe) 3) n-R f, where R f = CF(CF 3)OC 3F 7 and M n = 730), that was synthesized in house. The authors prepared a number of different F-SiNPs where the amount of the fluorinated silane was constant (200 mg) and the amount of N-(3-triethoxysilylpropyl)gluconamide was varied (10–1400 mg). Field-emission (FE)-SEM characterization of the particles indicated they were more cubic than spherical, Figure 8b, and dynamic light scattering showed diameters between 32–71 nm.
